___orient.description:
The orientation of a non-stacked bar, tick, area, and line charts.

The value is either horizontal (default) or vertical.

- For bar and tick, this determines whether the size of the bar and tick

should be applied to x or y dimension.

- For area, this property determines the orient property of the Vega output.

- For line, this property determines the sort order of the points in the line

if `config.sortLineBy` is not specified.

For stacked charts, this is always determined by the orientation of the stack;

therefore explicitly specified value will be ignored.

___align.description: The horizontal alignment of the text. One of left, right, center.

___filled.description:
Whether the shape\'s color should be used as fill color instead of stroke color.

This is only applicable for "bar", "point", and "area".

All marks except "point" marks are filled by default.

See Mark Documentation (http://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/marks.html)

for usage example.

___stroke.description: Default Stroke Color.  This has higher precedence than config.color

___barThinSize.description: The size of the bars on continuous scales.

___theta.description: Polar coordinate angle, in radians, of the text label from the origin determined by the x and y properties. Values for theta follow the same convention of arc mark startAngle and endAngle properties: angles are measured in radians, with 0 indicating "north".

___angle.description: The rotation angle of the text, in degrees.

___tension.description: Depending on the interpolation type, sets the tension parameter.

___barSize.description:
The size of the bars.  If unspecified, the default size is  `bandSize-1`,

which provides 1 pixel offset between bars.

___interpolate.description: The line interpolation method to use. One of linear, step-before, step-after, basis, basis-open, basis-closed, bundle, cardinal, cardinal-open, cardinal-closed, monotone.

___radius.description: Polar coordinate radial offset, in pixels, of the text label from the origin determined by the x and y properties.

___shape.description: The symbol shape to use. One of circle (default), square, cross, diamond, triangle-up, or triangle-down.

___strokeDash.description: An array of alternating stroke, space lengths for creating dashed or dotted lines.

___format.description: The formatting pattern for text value. If not defined, this will be determined automatically.

___shortTimeLabels.description: Whether month names and weekday names should be abbreviated.

___dy.description: The vertical offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the angle property.

___dx.description: The horizontal offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the angle property.

___applyColorToBackground.description: Apply color field to background color instead of the text.

___fill.description: Default Fill Color.  This has higher precedence than config.color

___baseline.description: The vertical alignment of the text. One of top, middle, bottom.

___font.description: The typeface to set the text in (e.g., Helvetica Neue).

___size.description: The pixel area each the point. For example: in the case of circles, the radius is determined in part by the square root of the size value.

___strokeDashOffset.description: The offset (in pixels) into which to begin drawing with the stroke dash array.

___field.description: The field name to aggregate over.

___min.description: The minimum bin value to consider. If unspecified, the minimum value of the specified field is used.

___div.description: Scale factors indicating allowable subdivisions. The default value is [5, 2], which indicates that for base 10 numbers (the default base), the method may consider dividing bin sizes by 5 and/or 2. For example, for an initial step size of 10, the method can check if bin sizes of 2 (= 10/5), 5 (= 10/2), or 1 (= 10/(5*2)) might also satisfy the given constraints.

___minstep.description: A minimum allowable step size (particularly useful for integer values).

___base.description: The number base to use for automatic bin determination (default is base 10).

___step.description: An exact step size to use between bins. If provided, options such as maxbins will be ignored.

___max.description: The maximum bin value to consider. If unspecified, the maximum value of the specified field is used.

___steps.description: An array of allowable step sizes to choose from.

___nominalColorRange.description: Default range for nominal color scale

___sequentialColorRange.description: Default range for ordinal / continuous color scale

___bandSize.description:
Default band size for (1) `y` ordinal scale,

and (2) `x` ordinal scale when the mark is not `text`.

___padding.description: Default padding for `x` and `y` ordinal scales.

___round.description:
If true, rounds numeric output values to integers.

This can be helpful for snapping to the pixel grid.

(Only available for `x`, `y`, `size`, `row`, and `column` scales.)

___textBandWidth.description: Default band width for `x` ordinal scale when is mark is `text`.

___pointSizeRange.description: Default range for bar size scale

___barSizeRange.description: Default range for bar size scale

___fontSizeRange.description: Default range for font size scale

___strokeDashOffset.description: The offset (in pixels) into which to begin drawing with the stroke dash array.

___titleOffset.description: A title offset value for the axis.

___tickPadding.description: The padding, in pixels, between ticks and text labels.

___subdivide.description: If provided, sets the number of minor ticks between major ticks (the value 9 results in decimal subdivision). Only applicable for axes visualizing quantitative scales.

___properties.description: Optional mark property definitions for custom axis styling.

___layer.description: A string indicating if the axis (and any gridlines) should be placed above or below the data marks.

___tickSize.description: The size, in pixels, of major, minor and end ticks.

___offset.description: The offset, in pixels, by which to displace the axis from the edge of the enclosing group or data rectangle.

___labelAngle.description: The rotation angle of the axis labels.

___grid.description: A flag indicate if gridlines should be created in addition to ticks. If `grid` is unspecified, the default value is `true` for ROW and COL. For X and Y, the default value is `true` for quantitative and time fields and `false` otherwise.

___shortTimeLabels.description: Whether month and day names should be abbreviated.

___characterWidth.description: Character width for automatically determining title max length.

___tickSizeEnd.description: The size, in pixels, of end ticks.

___ticks.description: A desired number of ticks, for axes visualizing quantitative scales. The resulting number may be different so that values are "nice" (multiples of 2, 5, 10) and lie within the underlying scale's range.

___labelMaxLength.description: Truncate labels that are too long.

___tickSizeMinor.description: The size, in pixels, of minor ticks.

___tickSizeMajor.description: The size, in pixels, of major ticks.

___titleMaxLength.description: Max length for axis title if the title is automatically generated from the field's description. By default, this is automatically based on cell size and characterWidth property.

___min.description: The minimum bin value to consider. If unspecified, the minimum value of the specified field is used.

___div.description: Scale factors indicating allowable subdivisions. The default value is [5, 2], which indicates that for base 10 numbers (the default base), the method may consider dividing bin sizes by 5 and/or 2. For example, for an initial step size of 10, the method can check if bin sizes of 2 (= 10/5), 5 (= 10/2), or 1 (= 10/(5*2)) might also satisfy the given constraints.

___minstep.description: A minimum allowable step size (particularly useful for integer values).

___base.description: The number base to use for automatic bin determination (default is base 10).

___step.description: An exact step size to use between bins. If provided, options such as maxbins will be ignored.

___max.description: The maximum bin value to consider. If unspecified, the maximum value of the specified field is used.

___steps.description: An array of allowable step sizes to choose from.

___min.description: The minimum bin value to consider. If unspecified, the minimum value of the specified field is used.

___div.description: Scale factors indicating allowable subdivisions. The default value is [5, 2], which indicates that for base 10 numbers (the default base), the method may consider dividing bin sizes by 5 and/or 2. For example, for an initial step size of 10, the method can check if bin sizes of 2 (= 10/5), 5 (= 10/2), or 1 (= 10/(5*2)) might also satisfy the given constraints.

___minstep.description: A minimum allowable step size (particularly useful for integer values).

___base.description: The number base to use for automatic bin determination (default is base 10).

___step.description: An exact step size to use between bins. If provided, options such as maxbins will be ignored.

___max.description: The maximum bin value to consider. If unspecified, the maximum value of the specified field is used.

___steps.description: An array of allowable step sizes to choose from.

___padding.description: Applies spacing among ordinal elements in the scale range. The actual effect depends on how the scale is configured. If the __points__ parameter is `true`, the padding value is interpreted as a multiple of the spacing between points. A reasonable value is 1.0, such that the first and last point will be offset from the minimum and maximum value by half the distance between points. Otherwise, padding is typically in the range [0, 1] and corresponds to the fraction of space in the range interval to allocate to padding. A value of 0.5 means that the range band width will be equal to the padding width. For more, see the [D3 ordinal scale documentation](https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/Ordinal-Scales).

___nice.description: If specified, modifies the scale domain to use a more human-friendly value range. If specified as a true boolean, modifies the scale domain to use a more human-friendly number range (e.g., 7 instead of 6.96). If specified as a string, modifies the scale domain to use a more human-friendly value range. For time and utc scale types only, the nice value should be a string indicating the desired time interval.

___zero.description: If true, ensures that a zero baseline value is included in the scale domain. This option is ignored for non-quantitative scales.

___round.description: If true, rounds numeric output values to integers. This can be helpful for snapping to the pixel grid.

___includeRawDomain.description: Uses the source data range as scale domain instead of aggregated data for aggregate axis. This option does not work with sum or count aggregate as they might have a substantially larger scale range.

___domain.description: The domain of the scale, representing the set of data values. For quantitative data, this can take the form of a two-element array with minimum and maximum values. For ordinal/categorical data, this may be an array of valid input values. The domain may also be specified by a reference to a data source.

___exponent.description: Sets the exponent of the scale transformation. For pow scale types only, otherwise ignored.

___clamp.description: If true, values that exceed the data domain are clamped to either the minimum or maximum range value

___range.description: The range of the scale, representing the set of visual values. For numeric values, the range can take the form of a two-element array with minimum and maximum values. For ordinal or quantized data, the range may by an array of desired output values, which are mapped to elements in the specified domain. For ordinal scales only, the range can be defined using a DataRef: the range values are then drawn dynamically from a backing data set.

___orient.description: The orientation of the axis. One of top, bottom, left or right. The orientation can be used to further specialize the axis type (e.g., a y axis oriented for the right edge of the chart).

___tickPadding.description: The padding, in pixels, between ticks and text labels.

___properties.description: Optional mark property definitions for custom axis styling.

___layer.description: A string indicating if the axis (and any gridlines) should be placed above or below the data marks.

___title.description: A title for the axis. Shows field name and its function by default.

___tickSize.description: The size, in pixels, of major, minor and end ticks.

___offset.description: The offset, in pixels, by which to displace the axis from the edge of the enclosing group or data rectangle.

___labelAngle.description: The rotation angle of the axis labels.

___labelMaxLength.description: Truncate labels that are too long.

___titleOffset.description: A title offset value for the axis.

___subdivide.description: If provided, sets the number of minor ticks between major ticks (the value 9 results in decimal subdivision). Only applicable for axes visualizing quantitative scales.

___grid.description: A flag indicate if gridlines should be created in addition to ticks. If `grid` is unspecified, the default value is `true` for ROW and COL. For X and Y, the default value is `true` for quantitative and time fields and `false` otherwise.

___format.description: The formatting pattern for axis labels.

___shortTimeLabels.description: Whether month and day names should be abbreviated.

___characterWidth.description: Character width for automatically determining title max length.

___tickSizeEnd.description: The size, in pixels, of end ticks.

___ticks.description: A desired number of ticks, for axes visualizing quantitative scales. The resulting number may be different so that values are "nice" (multiples of 2, 5, 10) and lie within the underlying scale's range.

___tickSizeMinor.description: The size, in pixels, of minor ticks.

___tickSizeMajor.description: The size, in pixels, of major ticks.

___titleMaxLength.description: Max length for axis title if the title is automatically generated from the field's description. By default, this is automatically based on cell size and characterWidth property.

___field.description: The field name to aggregate over.

___orient.description: The orientation of the legend. One of "left" or "right". This determines how the legend is positioned within the scene. The default is "right".

___format.description: An optional formatting pattern for legend labels. Vega uses D3\'s format pattern.

___shortTimeLabels.description: Whether month names and weekday names should be abbreviated.

___properties.description: Optional mark property definitions for custom legend styling.

___title.description: A title for the legend. (Shows field name and its function by default.)

___values.description: Explicitly set the visible legend values.

Otherwise, padding is typically in the range [0, 1] and corresponds to the fraction of space in the range interval to allocate to padding. A value of 0.5 means that the range band width will be equal to the padding width. For more, see the [D3 ordinal scale documentation](https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/Ordinal-Scales).

___div.description: Scale factors indicating allowable subdivisions. For example, for an initial step size of 10, the method can check if bin sizes of 2 (= 10/5), 5 (= 10/2), or 1 (= 10/(5*2)) might also satisfy the given constraints.

___minstep.description: A minimum allowable step size (particularly useful for integer values).

___base.description: The number base to use for automatic bin determination (default is base 10).

___step.description: An exact step size to use between bins. If provided, options such as maxbins will be ignored.

___max.description: The maximum bin value to consider. If unspecified, the maximum value of the specified field is used.

___orient.description: The orientation of the legend. One of "left" or "right". This determines how the legend is positioned within the scene. The default is "right".

___shortTimeLabels.description: Whether month names and weekday names should be abbreviated.

___properties.description: Optional mark property definitions for custom legend styling.

___values.description: Pass array of objects instead of a url to a file.

___numberFormat.description: D3 Number format for axis labels and text tables. For example "s" for SI units.

___filterNull.description: Filter null values from the data. If set to true, all rows with null values are filtered. If false, no rows are filtered. Set the property to undefined to filter only quantitative and temporal fields.

___calculate.description: Calculate new field(s) using the provided expresssion(s). Calculation are applied before filter.

___characterWidth.description: Character width for automatically determining title max length.

___tickSizeEnd.description: The size, in pixels, of end ticks.

___ticks.description: A desired number of ticks, for axes visualizing quantitative scales. The resulting number may be different so that values are "nice" (multiples of 2, 5, 10) and lie within the underlying scale's range.

___tickSizeMinor.description: The size, in pixels, of minor ticks.

___tickSizeMajor.description: The size, in pixels, of major ticks.

___titleMaxLength.description: Max length for axis title if the title is automatically generated from the field's description. By default, this is automatically based on cell size and characterWidth property.

___min.description: The minimum bin value to consider. If unspecified, the minimum value of the specified field is used.

___div.description: Scale factors indicating allowable subdivisions. The default value is [5, 2], which indicates that for base 10 numbers (the default base), the method may consider dividing bin sizes by 5 and/or 2. For example, for an initial step size of 10, the method can check if bin sizes of 2 (= 10/5), 5 (= 10/2), or 1 (= 10/(5*2)) might also satisfy the given constraints.

___minstep.description: A minimum allowable step size (particularly useful for integer values).

___base.description: The number base to use for automatic bin determination (default is base 10).

___step.description: An exact step size to use between bins. If provided, options such as maxbins will be ignored.

___max.description: The maximum bin value to consider. If unspecified, the maximum value of the specified field is used.

___steps.description: An array of allowable step sizes to choose from.

___strokeDashOffset.description: The offset (in pixels) into which to begin drawing with the stroke dash array.

___name.description: A name for the specification. The name is used to annotate marks, scale names, and more.

___numberFormat.description: D3 Number format for axis labels and text tables. For example "s" for SI units.

___viewport.description: The width and height of the on-screen viewport, in pixels. If necessary, clipping and scrolling will be applied.

___timeFormat.description: Default datetime format for axis and legend labels. The format can be set directly on each axis and legend.

___background.description: CSS color property to use as background of visualization. Default is `"transparent"`.

___filter.description: A string containing the filter Vega expression. Use `datum` to refer to the current data object.

___filterNull.description: Filter null values from the data. If set to true, all rows with null values are filtered. If false, no rows are filtered. Set the property to undefined to filter only quantitative and temporal fields.

___calculate.description: Calculate new field(s) using the provided expresssion(s). Calculation are applied before filter.

___values.description: Pass array of objects instead of a url to a file.
